occurrences.text: to have a Bible, and what a blessing. Numbers 14, we're gonna be jumping right in the middle of a text of scripture, verses 11 through 20 will be our text this morning. In Numbers 14, verses 11 through 20, I wanna read to you by way of introduction, verse 18 and 19, and then we'll get into the message this morning. But notice in Numbers 14, verse number 18, the Bible says this, this is Moses now talking back to the Lord, the Lord is long-suffering, is recalling what God has said, and of great mercy, forgiving iniquity and transgression, and by no means clearing the guilty, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children unto the third and fourth generation. Notice this in verse 19, pardon, I beseech thee, the iniquity of this people, according unto the greatness of thy mercy, and as thou hast forgiven this people from Egypt even until now. You'll notice there right in the midst of verse number 19, according unto the greatness of thy mercy, and I've used that as the title for the message this morning. occurrences.text: God is great, and I'm so thankful that his greatness is revealed to us in the pages of this precious book, and what a blessing it is to know great is the Lord and greatly to be praised, as we sang from Psalm 48, verses one and two this morning, and every service of this year, we've had the opportunity to sing that wonderful song and be reminded, as you come in, you see the banners on the wall, and understanding that great is the Lord, and what is it about God that makes him great? Well, there's several things, many things, and we've been studying those things, and we've kind of, as we've kind of taken the first part of 2023, to kind of categorize it this way, let's discover God's greatness. What is it that would cause you, that would cause me to say God is great? And then, as we enter into the latter part of the year, we'll deal with the subject of declaring his greatness. Of course, that was the theme for our missions conference just a couple of weeks ago, and we'll spend several messages at the end of this year. Now that we have discovered the greatness of God, we ought to be declaring the greatness of God. This morning in this text of scripture, we find that Moses makes reference to the greatness of God's mercy, and it's a blessing to consider that our God is merciful.
